GroundObstacleDetectionTOF.title: Ground Obstacle Detection (TOF)
GroundObstacleDetectionTOF.description: This project uses hybrid TOF camera gray scale images to build a model to detect objects on the ground like toys, hedgehogs, balls, humans, and other obstacles.

MovementTypeDetection.title: Movement Type Detection
MovementTypeDetection.description: Project to build a model that classifies the movement pattern of an IMU Sensor: Stationary, Shaking or Circle.

HomeSoundsDetection.title: Home Sounds Detection
HomeSoundsDetection.description: This project uses a microphone to detect sound signatures common to a home: baby cry, cough, water tap.

DrillMaterialDetectionMicrophone.title: Drill Material Detection Audio
DrillMaterialDetectionMicrophone.description: Project that uses a microphone to detect the material being drilled into using audio signature.

PROJECT_TEMPLATE.title: Project Title MAX 40 characters
sensors: Specify sensor(s) used in your project: Microphone, IMU, Camera, etc.
domain: Specify domain(s) of your project: Audio, Voice, Vision, etc.
application: Specify application(s) of your project: Smart Home, Smart TV, Appliances, Wearables, Games, etc.
use_case: Specify use case(s) of your project: Object Detection, Voice Control, Speech Recognition, etc.
kit: Specify Infineon kit(s) your project is compatible with: PSoC-6 Pioneer Kit, PSoC-6 AI Kit, PSoC-Edge AI Kit, etc.
device: Specify device(s) your project is compatible with: PSoC-4, PSoC-6, PSoC-Edge, AURIX, etc.
workflow: Choose between ML Development and/or ML Deployment

SirenDetection.description: This Studio Accelerator uses a microphone to detect if you have an emergency vehicle siren in the vicinity.

DrillMaterialDetectionIMU.description: Project for classifying what material a power drill is drilling into using IMU.

RoadUsersDetection.description: Project to build a model that detects people, trains, cars, busses, bicycles, motorbikes in an image.

GunshotDetection.title: Gunshot Detection
GunshotDetection.description: Project that uses a microphone to identify gunshots.

BabyCryDetection.title: Baby Cry Detection (Studio Accelerator)
BabyCryDetection.description: This Studio Accelerator uses a microphone to detect if a baby is crying in the vicinity.

SurfaceDetectionMicrophone.title: Vacuum Cleaner Surface Detection (MIC)
SurfaceDetectionMicrophone.description: Project showcasing microphone-based surface detection for vacuum cleaners (Floor/Carpet/Air).

GesturesDetectionCapsense.title: Gestures Detection (CAPSENSE)
GesturesDetectionCapsense.description: CAPSENSE-based gestures detection model detects up, down, left and right gestures

FallDetection.title: Fall Detection (Belt-mounted)
FallDetection.description: Project to build a model that detects if the user has fallen. It's intended to be placed on a belt or waist.

HumanActivity.title: Human Activity Detection
HumanActivity.description: Project to build a model to detect whether a person is performing different activities e.g. walking.

KeywordDetector.title: Keyword Detection
KeywordDetector.description: This machine learning project contains everything to get started with keyword detection.

RockPaperScissorsDetection.title: Rock Paper Scissors Detection
RockPaperScissorsDetection.description: Project to build a model that recognizes hand gestures (Rock, Paper or Scissors) in an image.

MotorImbalanceDetection.title: Motor Load Imbalance Detection
MotorImbalanceDetection.description: Project to build a model that detects if the load of an electric motor is balanced or not.

Yolov8nPersonDetection.title: Yolo v8n Person Detection
Yolov8nPersonDetection.long_description: Yolov8n is a lightweight and efficient object detection model designed for instance segmentation tasks. It is part of the YOLO (You Only Look Once) family of models, known for their real-time object detection capabilities. The "n" in Yolov8n_detection indicates that it is a nano version, optimized for speed and resource efficiency, making it suitable for deployment on devices with limited computational power, such as mobile devices and embedded systems. Yolov8n is implemented in Pytorch by Ultralytics and is quantized in int8 format using tensorflow lite converter. YOLOv8n-detect is an ultra-efficient object detection model delivering pixel-perfect object detection in resource-constrained environments. This lightweight powerhouse combines the renowned YOLO architecture with advanced efficiency optimizations for edge AI applications. Yolov8n_Person detect represents the cutting edge of efficient computer vision, enabling sophisticated pixel-level object detection on devices previously limited to basic detection tasks. Experience YOLO's renowned speed and accuracy in an ultra-compact format engineered specifically for edge deployment scenarios. Download today!

links.label: GitHub
links.heading: Try Today
links.sub-heading: Deploy the pre-trained model to your PSOC™ Edge Eval Kit

EfficientnetLite.title: EfficientNet Lite
EfficientnetLite.long_description: EfficientNet Lite is a lightweight deep learning model optimized for image classification on edge devices. It builds on EfficientNet’s compound scaling, balancing depth, width, and resolution for efficiency. Trained on ImageNet, it delivers high accuracy with low latency, making it ideal for mobile and embedded AI applications requiring real-time inference.

MobileNetV2LeafDisease.title: MobileNet V2 Leaf Disease
MobileNetV2LeafDisease.description: Predict classes for various plant leaf diseases
MobileNetV2LeafDisease.long_description: MobileNetV2 is a lightweight and efficient deep learning model developed by Google, ideal for image classification on mobile and edge devices. When applied to the PlantVillage dataset, it takes input images of size 224x224x3 (RGB format of plant leaves) and outputs the predicted classes for various plant leaf diseases. MobileNetV2 uses advanced techniques like depthwise separable convolutions and inverted residuals to reduce model size and computational cost. It is well-suited for real-time plant leaf disease detection in mobile farming apps, smart agriculture devices, and low-power field equipment where fast and efficient processing is critical.

links.heading: Try Today

EfficientNetV2-S.title: EfficientNet V2-S Food Classification
EfficientNetV2-S.description: Fast and accurate CNN for image classification
EfficientNetV2-S.long_description: EfficientNetV2-S is a fast and accurate convolutional neural network designed for image classification tasks, optimized for both training speed and model performance, commonly used in real-time applications like mobile vision, medical imaging, and defect detection.

YoloX.title: Yolo X
YoloX.long_description: IFX YOLO-X is a real-time object detection model designed for efficient processing and optimized for performance. Implemented in TensorFlow, it is a customized and optimized version of the widely known YOLO-X model. This variant is quantized to int8 format using the TensorFlow Lite converter, enhancing its suitability for deployment on resource-constrained devices. IFX YOLO-X is specifically trained on the COCO dataset, focusing on person detection tasks. IFX YOLO-X is a real-time object detection model engineered for efficient processing and optimized performance on edge devices. This specialized variant of the popular YOLO-X architecture focuses on person detection tasks with enhanced resource efficiency for deployment in constrained computing environments. IFX YOLO-X delivers the powerful object detection capabilities of the YOLO family while being specifically engineered for person detection tasks in edge computing scenarios, making it ideal for applications requiring reliable human presence detection with minimal computational resources.

Squeezenet.title: Squeezenet
Squeezenet.long_description: SqueezeNet is an image classification model known for its lightweight architecture. It was designed to achieve high accuracy while minimizing the number of parameters required for training.

ArcFace.title: ArcFace
ArcFace.description: Angular margin loss for accurate face verification
ArcFace.long_description: ArcFace Face Recognition is a deep learning-based system that utilizes angular margin loss for accurate face verification. It processes facial images to extract identity-specific embeddings, ensuring robust recognition across varying poses, lighting, and occlusions. The model employs advanced feature extraction and normalization techniques to enhance accuracy in dynamic environments. Unlike traditional methods, it optimizes angular separation in the feature space to improve classification and matching performance. This approach enables high-precision facial recognition for applications in security, biometric authentication, and identity verification.

links.label: GitHub
links.heading: Try Today
links.sub-heading: Deploy the pre-trained model to your PSOC™ Edge Eval Kit

Yolact.title: YOLACT
Yolact.long_description: The YOLACT Person Segmentation Model enables real-time person segmentation with efficient edge computing. It accurately detects, segments, and counts individuals in a given frame, making it ideal for embedded vision applications. Optimized for low-power, high-performance inference, it ensures fast and precise segmentation. This model enhances human presence detection for security, surveillance, and smart monitoring systems. The model can detect and segment more than one person in a given frame simultaneously while providing the total person count. Segmentation remains stable for up to five people in a single frame. These capabilities make it highly reliable for real-time applications requiring multiple-person detection and tracking.

links.label: GitHub
links.heading: Try Today
links.sub-heading: Deploy the pre-trained model to your PSOC™ Edge Eval Kit

SSDMobileNetV1.title: SSD MobileNet V1
SSDMobileNetV1.description: Efficient object detection on edge devices
SSDMobileNetV1.long_description: The MobileNet-SSD model is a Single-Shot Multibox Detection (SSD) network designed for object detection tasks. It uses MobileNet as its backbone architecture, which is a flexible and efficient design suitable for various use cases. Depending on the specific application, the model can utilize different input sizes and width multipliers, allowing for adjustments in model size and computational cost. This flexibility helps to significantly lower the number of multiply-add operations, making the model well-suited for inference on mobile and edge devices. MobileNet-SSD is a Single-Shot Multibox Detection network engineered for efficient object detection on edge devices. This versatile model combines the lightweight MobileNet backbone architecture with SSD detection methodology to deliver optimized performance in resource-constrained environments. Additionally, the model is quantized to int8 using the TensorFlow Lite converter to further optimize it for performance on resource-constrained environments. MobileNet-SSD provides exceptional versatility through its configurable design parameters, allowing developers to fine-tune the model's size and computational requirements according to specific deployment scenarios while maintaining effective object detection capabilities on edge computing platforms.

links.label: GitHub
links.heading: Try Today
links.sub-heading: Deploy the pre-trained model to your PSOC™ Edge Eval Kit

Yolov8nPose.title: Yolo v8n Pose
Yolov8nPose.description: Lightweight model for multi pose estimation
Yolov8nPose.long_description: Yolov8n_pose is a lightweight and efficient model designed for multi pose estimation tasks. It is part of the YOLO (You Only Look Once) family of models, known for their real-time object detection capabilities. SSDMobileNetV2.title: SSD MobileNet v2
SSDMobileNetV2.description: Efficient object detection on edge devices
SSDMobileNetV2.long_description: The MobileNet-SSD model is a Single-Shot Multibox Detection (SSD) network designed for object detection tasks. It utilizes MobileNetV2 as its backbone, which is a versatile architecture suitable for various applications. Depending on the specific use case, the model can adapt by using different input layer sizes and width factors. This flexibility helps reduce the number of multiply-add operations, thereby lowering inference costs, especially on mobile devices. MobileNet-SSD is a Single-Shot Multibox Detection network engineered for efficient object detection on edge devices. This versatile model combines the lightweight MobileNetV2 backbone architecture with SSD detection methodology to deliver optimized performance in resource-constrained environments. The model has been quantized to int8 using the TensorFlow Lite converter to optimize performance further. MobileNet-SSD provides exceptional versatility through its configurable design parameters, allowing developers to fine-tune the model's size and computational requirements according to specific deployment scenarios while maintaining effective object detection capabilities on edge computing platforms.

YoloLCV1.title: Yolo LC V1
YoloLCV1.long_description: The Yolo LC v1 is a real-time object detection model designed for real-time processing and implemented in TensorFlow. It has been trained on the COCO person dataset and is specifically used for person detection tasks. ST Yolo LC v1 is a real-time object detection model engineered specifically for person detection tasks on edge devices. This specialized implementation delivers efficient human presence detection with optimized performance characteristics for deployment in resource-constrained computing environments. The model has been quantized to the INT8 format using the TensorFlow Lite converter. ST Yolo LC v1 represents a highly specialized object detection solution, concentrating exclusively on human presence detection to deliver superior performance in edge computing environments where both speed and accuracy are essential.

DeepLabv3.title: DeepLab V3
DeepLabv3.long_description: DeepLabv3 MobileNetv2 ASPPv2 is a lightweight semantic segmentation model that combines DeepLabv3's powerful Atrous Spatial Pyramid Pooling (ASPPv2) with the efficient MobileNetv2 backbone. It excels at capturing multi-scale contextual information while remaining highly optimized for mobile and edge devices. This design achieves a strong balance between accuracy and computational efficiency, making it ideal for real-time person segmentation tasks.

Yolov8nImageSegmentation.long_description: YOLOv8n is a compact and fast model tailored for real-time instance segmentation, making it well-suited for edge devices like PSOC(tm) Edge. DarkNet53.title: DarkNet53
DarkNet53.long_description: The DarkNet53 Face Detection model detects faces in images and returns bounding boxes along with five facial keypoints for face alignment. It is useful for computer vision tasks like facial recognition and security systems. The model performs well with straight faces and can detect faces up to a distance of 1 meter. In group settings, it accurately identifies people in the forefront. Additionally, it supports motion tracking using keypoints. This makes it ideal for applications requiring reliable face detection in controlled environments.

links.heading: Try Today
links.sub-heading: Deploy the pre-trained model to your PSOC™ Edge Eval Kit

MovenetLightning.title: Movenet Lightning
MovenetLightning.long_description: MoveNet Lightning model is a lightweight human pose estimation model optimized for real-time performance on edge devices (RPI), specifically using the Lightning variant for speed. Built on a CenterNet architecture with a MobileNetV2 backbone and an FPN, it predicts the position and confidence scores of 17 human body keypoints.

HandLandmarks.title: Hand Landmarks
HandLandmarks.description: Locates key points (landmarks) on a human hand
HandLandmarks.long_description: The hand landmarks estimation model determines 21 key points in the palm and tracks the movement and the position of the different points in the palm. A hand landmarks detection model identifies and locates key points (landmarks) on a human hand, such as fingertips, joints, and wrist position, from an image or video frame. It enables detailed hand pose estimation, useful for gesture recognition, sign language interpretation, augmented reality, and human-computer interaction tasks.

links.heading: Try Today

Resnet50V2FoodClassification.title: Resnet50 V2 Food Classification
Resnet50V2FoodClassification.description: Resnet50 V2 trained for food recognition
Resnet50V2FoodClassification.long_description: ResNet50V2 is a deep convolutional neural network designed for accurate image classification. It is an improved version of ResNet50 with better training performance and stability due to improved skip connections. When used with the Food-101 dataset, ResNet50V2 takes food images as input and classifies them into 101 different food categories like pizza, burger, or sushi. It’s commonly used in food recognition apps, smart kitchen systems, and calorie tracking tools. Its importance lies in its high accuracy and ability to handle complex food images, making it valuable for diet monitoring, restaurant automation, and nutrition analysis.

links.heading: Try Today
links.sub-heading: Deploy the pre-trained model to your PSOC™ Edge Eval Kit

MobileFaceNet.title: Mobile FaceNet
MobileFaceNet.long_description: MobileFaceNet is a lightweight, efficient deep learning model specifically engineered for facial recognition applications on mobile and embedded devices. Built upon a modified MobileNetV2 architecture, this model incorporates depthwise separable convolutions to significantly reduce computational requirements while maintaining accuracy.Trained on the comprehensive MS-Celeb-1M dataset, MobileFaceNet delivers robust feature extraction capabilities for face verification and recognition tasks. The model employs an optimized backbone with a streamlined parameter count to enhance processing speed and operational efficiency.MobileFaceNet performs with high accuracy on frontal-facing subjects and individuals without eyewear that obscures key facial features. The system may experience reduced recognition accuracy when facial elements, particularly the eyes, are significantly concealed.
